name: Rocket Propulsion
description: This course provides an in-depth study of the fundamentals of rocket propulsion, covering topics such as propulsion theory, engine types, fuel chemistry, and the practical applications of rocket technology. Designed for students with a strong background in physics and engineering, the course includes both theoretical instruction and hands-on laboratory work

modules.name: Introduction to Rocket Propulsion
modules.description: Basic principles of rocket propulsion and rocket engines.

lessons.name: History of Rocketry
lessons.description: A brief history of rocketry and space exploration.

lessons.name: Rocket Engine Types
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket engines.

modules.name: Fuel and Combustion
modules.description: Understanding rocket fuel, combustion processes, and efficiency.

lessons.name: Rocket Fuel
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket fuels.

modules.name: Nozzle Design
modules.description: Principles of rocket nozzle design and performance optimization.

lessons.name: Nozzle Design
lessons.description: Overview of different types of rocket nozzles.

lessons.name: Nozzle Optimization
lessons.description: Optimizing nozzle design for specific applications.

assignments.title: Propulsion Assignment
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Design and analyze a comprehensive rocket propulsion system for a Mars mission.

assignments.title: Combustion Analysis
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Conduct a detailed combustion analysis for rocket propulsion systems.

assignments.title: Nozzle Design Project
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Design an optimal rocket nozzle for maximum thrust efficiency.

name: Aerodynamics
description: This course offers a comprehensive exploration of aerodynamics, focusing on the principles and applications of airflow and its effects on flying objects. Topics include fluid dynamics, airfoil design, lift and drag forces, and the aerodynamic considerations in aircraft design. The course blends theoretical learning with practical applications, suitable for students pursuing a career in aeronautics or astronautics engineering.

modules.name: Fundamentals of Aerodynamics
modules.description: Basic aerodynamic concepts and fluid dynamics principles.

modules.name: Subsonic and Supersonic Flow
modules.description: Understanding subsonic and supersonic aerodynamic behaviors.

modules.name: Aerodynamic Heating
modules.description: Study of aerodynamic heating and thermal protection systems.

assignments.title: Aerodynamics Quiz
assignments.description:
The quiz is available online.

Complete a comprehensive assessment covering fundamental aerodynamics principles.

assignments.title: Flow Analysis
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Perform computational fluid dynamics analysis on spacecraft surfaces during atmospheric entry.

assignments.title: Heating Analysis
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Calculate and analyze aerodynamic heating effects during spacecraft re-entry.

name: Spacecraft Design
description: This course delves into the principles and practices of spacecraft design, offering students a detailed understanding of the engineering and technology behind spacecraft systems. Key topics include spacecraft structure, propulsion, power systems, thermal control, and payload integration. Emphasizing both theoretical concepts and practical skills, the course prepares students for careers in the space industry, with a focus on innovative design and problem-solving in the context of current and future space missions

modules.name: Spacecraft Structural Design
modules.description: Fundamentals of designing spacecraft structures and materials selection.

modules.name: Orbital Mechanics
modules.description: Understanding orbital dynamics and mission planning.

modules.name: Spacecraft Systems Engineering
modules.description: Overview of spacecraft systems and subsystems engineering.

assignments.title: Structural Design Task
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Design spacecraft structural components considering mechanical loads and material properties.

assignments.title: Orbital Calculations
assignments.description:
The assignment is available online.

Calculate orbital mechanics for a satellite mission from Earth to Mars.

assignments.title: Systems Engineering Exam
assignments.description:
The exam is available online.

Comprehensive examination covering spacecraft systems engineering principles.

name: Organic Chemistry
description: Organic Chemistry is an in-depth course that explores the structure, properties, composition, and reactions of organic compounds and materials.

name: Inorganic Chemistry
description: Inorganic Chemistry focuses on the properties, structures, and behaviors of inorganic and organometallic compounds.

name: Physical Chemistry
description: Physical Chemistry merges the principles of physics and chemistry to understand the physical properties of molecules.

name: Ancient Languages and Scripts of Middle-earth
description: This course offers an exploration of the ancient languages and scripts found throughout Middle-earth.

name: Wizards, Elves, and Men: Inter-species Diplomacy in Middle-earth
description: This course explores the complex relationships and diplomatic interactions among the different races of Middle-earth.
